qas.question: In what year did Louis XIV die?
In what year did the French Revolution begin?
In what decade did the scientific revolution begin?

context: French historians traditionally place the Enlightenment between <a0_0>1715<a0_0/>, the year that Louis XIV died, and <a1_0>1789<a1_0/>, the beginning of the French Revolution. Some recent historians begin the period in the <a2_0>1620s<a2_0/>, with the start of the scientific revolution. The Philosophes, the French term for the philosophers of the period, widely circulated their ideas through meetings at scientific academies, Masonic lodges, literary salons and coffee houses, and through printed books and pamphlets. The ideas of the Enlightenment undermined the authority of the monarchy and the church, and paved the way for the revolutions of the 18th and 19th centuries. A variety of 19th-century movements, including liberalism and neo-classicism, trace their intellectual heritage back to the Enlightenment.
